column1: Question

A cylindrical barrel with a radius of 0.5 meters is filled with water and has a small hole at its side at a height of 0.2 meters from the bottom. If the speed of water flow from the hole is 3 meters per second when the barrel is full, calculate the time taken for the water level to fall from 2 meters to 0.2 meters.

A particle of mass 0.15 kg is projected upwards with an initial speed of 20 m/s at an angle of 30 degrees with the horizontal. Considering air resistance that is directly proportional to the square of the velocity, determine the equations for the trajectory of the particle.

In a two-slit interference experiment, the distance between the slits is 0.5 mm and the wavelength of the light used is 600 nm. If the screen is placed at a distance of 2 meters from the slits, calculate the distance between the central bright fringe and the 5th bright fringe.

A pendulum consists of a bob of mass 0.2 kg attached to a string of length 1 meter and executes small oscillations. If the bob passes through the lowest point with a speed of 2 m/s, calculate the maximum height reached by the bob.
An electric dipole consists of charges +3e and -3e separated by a distance of 0.5 nm. Calculate the electric field at a point on the axial line at a distance of 5 nm from the center of the dipole.

A block of mass 2 kg is placed on a wedge of mass 5 kg which in turn is placed on a frictionless horizontal surface. If the wedge makes an angle of 30 degrees with the horizontal, and the coefficient of friction between the block and the wedge is 0.1, find the acceleration of the block and the wedge.

A satellite is in a circular orbit of radius 10,000 km around a planet of mass 5.97x10^24 kg. If the satellite launches a sub-satellite in the radial direction with a speed of 500 m/s, find the maximum height reached by the sub-satellite relative to the surface of the planet.

A bimetallic strip is made up of metals A and B which have coefficients of linear expansion of 1.2x10^-5/°C and 1.8x10^-5/°C respectively. If the strip is heated from 20°C to 120°C, calculate the curvature radius of the strip.

Two resistors with resistances of 10 ohms and 15 ohms are connected in a series circuit with a battery of voltage 9 volts. If the temperature of the 10-ohm resistor increases, changing its resistance to 12 ohms, calculate the new current in the circuit.

A railgun consists of two parallel conductive rails 0.1 meters apart, connected by a moving conductive projectile of mass 0.5 kg. If a current of 50,000 A flows through the system, calculate the force on the projectile and the final velocity assuming the current remains constant.

An insulated container has two compartments separated by an insulating wall. One compartment contains an ideal gas at a pressure of 100 kPa, volume of 0.5 cubic meters, and temperature of 300K, while the other contains the same gas at 200 kPa, 0.25 cubic meters, and 400K. If the wall is removed, find the final equilibrium temperature of the gas.

A thin film of oil with a refractive index of 1.25 floats on water. If the film is illuminated with light of wavelength 550 nm, calculate the condition for constructive and destructive interference given the thickness of the oil film is 400 nm.

A car moves around a banked circular track with a radius of 200 meters at a speed of 25 m/s. If the banking angle is 20 degrees and the coefficient of static friction is 0.7, calculate the range of speeds for which the car will not slip on the track.

A guitar string of length 1.2 meters and mass per unit length of 0.01 kg/m is fixed at both ends. If the tension in the string is 800 N, calculate the frequencies of the fundamental and first two overtones.

A heat engine operates between two reservoirs at temperatures of 500K and 300K. If the engine absorbs 4000J of heat from the hot reservoir and does work of 1500J, calculate the efficiency of the engine and the heat rejected to the cold reservoir.
A 0.75 kg ball is thrown straight up with an initial velocity of 15 m/s from a height of 1.5 meters. Calculate the maximum height it reaches and the time it takes to return to the thrower's hand.

A roller coaster car with a mass of 500 kg is moving with a speed of 20 m/s at the bottom of a vertical loop of radius 25 meters. Determine the normal force exerted on the car by the track at the bottom of the loop.
A refrigerator has a coefficient of performance of 3.0 and requires 200 W of power to operate. Calculate the amount of heat removed from the inside of the refrigerator per hour.
A diverging lens has a focal length of -10 cm. If an object is placed 30 cm from the lens, calculate the image distance and the magnification of the image.
A charge of 8 µC is placed at a point in space where the electric field strength is 500 N/C. Calculate the force experienced by the charge.

A 3 kg mass is attached to a spring with a spring constant of 400 N/m. If the mass is displaced 10 cm from equilibrium and released, calculate the period of oscillation and the maximum speed of the mass.

A 10-turn coil with an area of 0.02 m² is placed in a magnetic field of 0.5 T. The plane of the coil is initially perpendicular to the magnetic field. If the coil is rotated 180 degrees in 0.1 seconds, calculate the average induced emf during this time.
A 0.2 kg stone is whirled in a horizontal circle of radius 2 meters at a constant speed of 6 m/s. Calculate the tension in the string and the period of the motion.
A spacecraft with a mass of 2,000 kg is in a circular orbit 400 km above Earth's surface. Calculate the velocity of the spacecraft and the period of its orbit.

A block of mass 4 kg is sliding down an inclined plane of length 5 meters with a coefficient of kinetic friction of 0.3. The inclined plane makes an angle of 25 degrees with the horizontal. Calculate the acceleration of the block and the time it takes to slide down the plane.

A tuning fork vibrating at 512 Hz is held above a resonance tube partially filled with water. If the speed of sound in air is 340 m/s, find the first two lengths of the air column that will resonate with the tuning fork.

A parallel plate capacitor is made up of two plates, each with an area of 0.1 m², separated by a distance of 1 mm with air between them. If a voltage of 12 V is applied, calculate the capacitance and the charge stored on the plates.

A horizontal force of 25 N is applied to a box of mass 5 kg resting on a horizontal surface. If the coefficient of static friction is 0.4, determine whether the box will start moving, and if so, calculate the acceleration.
An aluminum rod of length 2 meters is heated from 20°C to 200°C. Given that the coefficient of linear expansion for aluminum is 24 x 10^-6/°C, calculate the change in length of the rod.
A bullet of mass 50 g is fired from a gun of mass 2 kg with a speed of 400 m/s. Calculate the recoil speed of the gun.
A car accelerates uniformly from rest to a speed of 25 m/s in 10 seconds. Calculate the acceleration and the distance covered by the car during this time.
A pendulum of length 1.5 meters is released from a 45-degree angle. Calculate the speed of the pendulum bob at its lowest point.

A bullet with a mass of 20 g is fired horizontally into a 3 kg wooden block resting on a frictionless surface. The bullet embeds into the block. If the bullet-block system moves with a speed of 1.5 m/s after the collision, calculate the initial speed of the bullet.
A 100 W lightbulb converts 5% of the energy into visible light. Calculate the amount of energy converted into visible light in 2 hours.

In a hydraulic lift, the radius of the smaller piston is 5 cm and the radius of the larger piston is 30 cm. If a force of 200 N is applied to the smaller piston, calculate the force exerted by the larger piston.
A 0.5 kg ball is attached to the end of a string and is swung in a vertical circle of radius 1 meter. At the top of the circle, calculate the tension in the string if the speed of the ball is 4 m/s.

A satellite is in a geostationary orbit above the equator. Given that the radius of the Earth is approximately 6400 km and the gravitational constant \( G \) is \( 6.674 \times 10^{-11} \, \text{Nm}^2/\text{kg}^2 \), calculate the mass of the Earth.
A 2 kg block slides down a 30-degree inclined plane with an acceleration of 2 m/s². Calculate the coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the plane.

A capacitor is charged by a 12 V battery and then disconnected from the battery. When a dielectric material with a dielectric constant of 5 is inserted between the plates, fully filling the space, calculate the new capacitance and the new charge on the capacitor plates.
A 25 cm long solenoid with 100 turns has a current of 2 A passing through it. Calculate the magnetic field strength inside the solenoid.

A 15 kg mass is suspended by a wire. The wire has a cross-sectional area of 0.1 cm² and a length of 2 meters. If the wire stretches by 1 mm under the mass, calculate the Young's modulus of the material of the wire.
A 0.1 kg mass attached to a horizontal spring oscillates with a period of 2 seconds. If the spring constant is 25 N/m, calculate the amplitude of the oscillation.
A sound wave with a frequency of 256 Hz travels from air into water. If the speed of sound in air is 343 m/s and in water is 1482 m/s, calculate the wavelength of the sound wave in water.

A 1 kg block of copper at 100°C is placed in 2 kg of water at 20°C. If the specific heat of copper is \( 0.385 \, \text{J/g°C} \) and that of water is \( 4.18 \, \text{J/g°C} \), calculate the final temperature of the system assuming no heat loss to the surroundings.

A charged particle with a charge of 2 µC is moving with a velocity of \( 5 \times 10^6 \) m/s perpendicular to a magnetic field of \( 0.01 \) T. Calculate the magnitude of the magnetic force on the particle.
A 2.0 kg block is pushed against a spring with spring constant 400 N/m, compressing it by 0.15 m. If the block is released from rest, calculate the maximum speed the block will reach.
A roller coaster car starts from rest at the top of a 50 m high track and descends to the bottom. Neglecting friction, calculate the speed of the car at the bottom of the track.
A 10-turn coil with an area of 0.02 m² is placed in a magnetic field of strength 0.5 T. If the magnetic field is reduced to zero in 0.1 seconds, calculate the average induced emf in the coil.
A 0.25 kg block on a horizontal surface is attached to a spring with a spring constant of 300 N/m. If the block is pulled 0.2 m from equilibrium and released, calculate the period of the motion.

A 5.0 kg block is sliding up a 30° incline with an initial speed of 10 m/s. If the coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the incline is 0.3, calculate how far up the incline the block will go before stopping.

A 50 Ω resistor, a 10 µF capacitor, and a 10 mH inductor are connected in series with a 120 V, 60 Hz AC source. Calculate the impedance of the circuit and the phase angle between the current and the voltage.
A 4 kg block is dropped from a height of 10 m onto a spring with spring constant 2000 N/m. Calculate how much the spring will compress when the block comes to rest momentarily.
Two charges, 5 µC and -3 µC, are placed 0.2 m apart. Calculate the electric field at a point 0.1 m from the 5 µC charge along the line connecting the two charges.

A 0.02 kg bullet traveling at 500 m/s strikes a 2.5 kg wooden block at rest on a frictionless surface. If the bullet emerges from the block with a speed of 100 m/s, calculate the speed of the block after the bullet emerges.

A 3.0 kg block is on a surface inclined at 45° to the horizontal. If the coefficient of static friction between the block and the surface is 0.5, calculate the minimum force parallel to the incline required to start moving the block.

A tuning fork vibrating at 512 Hz is held above a resonance tube partially filled with water. If the speed of sound is 340 m/s, calculate the first two lengths of the air column that will produce resonance.
An object is dropped from a height of 45 m. Using g = 9.81 m/s², calculate the time it will take for the object to reach the ground and the velocity with which it will strike the ground.

A diver springs upward from a board that is 3 meters above the water. If the diver jumps upward with a velocity of 4 m/s, calculate the diver's height above the water at the highest point and the total time before the diver hits the water.
A 0.5 kg mass is attached to a vertical spring and released from rest with the spring initially unstressed. If the spring constant is 100 N/m, calculate the maximum extension of the spring.
A 60 W lightbulb is connected to a 240 V power supply. Calculate the resistance of the lightbulb and the current flowing through it.
A 200 g steel ball is dropped from a height of 2.5 m onto a steel plate. If the collision is perfectly elastic, calculate the height to which the ball will bounce back.

A 15 g bullet is fired horizontally into a 1.2 kg wooden block that is suspended by a 1.5 m long string, causing the block to swing up to a height of 0.25 m. Calculate the initial speed of the bullet.
A satellite orbits Earth at an altitude where the free-fall acceleration is 5.0 m/s². If the radius of Earth is 6,371 km, calculate the orbital speed and period of the satellite.
A 0.75 kg mass on a spring with a spring constant of 120 N/m oscillates with an amplitude of 0.1 m. Calculate the maximum acceleration of the mass and the speed at the equilibrium position.
A light ray enters a glass slab at an angle of 30° with the normal and exits at an angle of 22°. Calculate the index of refraction of the glass.
A car traveling at 22 m/s needs to come to a complete stop within a distance of 75 m to avoid hitting an obstacle. Calculate the constant deceleration required and the time taken to stop.
A small motorboat crosses a river with a velocity of 8 m/s relative to the water. If the river flows at 3 m/s, calculate the resultant velocity of the boat and the angle relative to the riverbank.
A 0.2 m long metal rod is moved at 4 m/s perpendicular to a magnetic field of strength 0.5 T. Calculate the induced emf across the ends of the rod.
A 50 g ice cube at 0°C is dropped into 200 g of water at 50°C. Calculate the final temperature of the system assuming no heat loss to the surroundings.

A 15 g bullet is fired horizontally into a 1.2 kg wooden block that is suspended by a 1.5 m long string, causing the block to swing up to a height of 0.25 m. Calculate the initial speed of the bullet.
A satellite orbits Earth at an altitude where the free-fall acceleration is 5.0 m/s². If the radius of Earth is 6,371 km, calculate the orbital speed and period of the satellite.
A 0.75 kg mass on a spring with a spring constant of 120 N/m oscillates with an amplitude of 0.1 m. Calculate the maximum acceleration of the mass and the speed at the equilibrium position.
A light ray enters a glass slab at an angle of 30° with the normal and exits at an angle of 22°. Calculate the index of refraction of the glass.
A car traveling at 22 m/s needs to come to a complete stop within a distance of 75 m to avoid hitting an obstacle. Calculate the constant deceleration required and the time taken to stop.
A small motorboat crosses a river with a velocity of 8 m/s relative to the water. If the river flows at 3 m/s, calculate the resultant velocity of the boat and the angle relative to the riverbank.
A 0.2 m long metal rod is moved at 4 m/s perpendicular to a magnetic field of strength 0.5 T. Calculate the induced emf across the ends of the rod.
A 50 g ice cube at 0°C is dropped into 200 g of water at 50°C. Calculate the final temperature of the system assuming no heat loss to the surroundings.
A pendulum has a length of 0.8 m and makes 25 complete swings in 40 seconds. Calculate the acceleration due to gravity at the location of the pendulum.

An RLC circuit contains a 40 Ω resistor, a 3 mH inductor, and a 5 µF capacitor. If an AC source with a peak voltage of 120 V and a frequency of 500 Hz is connected, calculate the peak current in the circuit.
A small plane aims to fly directly north but encounters a wind blowing from the northeast at 10 m/s. If the plane's airspeed is 75 m/s, calculate the velocity of the plane relative to the ground.
A 100 W electric heater is used to heat 250 g of water from 20°C to boiling point. Calculate the time required assuming 100% efficiency and that the specific heat capacity of water is 4.18 J/g°C.
A 0.15 kg rubber ball is dropped from a height of 1.2 m onto a hard surface and rebounds to a height of 0.8 m. Calculate the loss of energy due to the bounce.
A cyclist accelerates from rest to 6 m/s in 3 seconds. If the mass of the cyclist and the bike together is 90 kg, calculate the force exerted by the cyclist.
A 1500 kg car accelerates uniformly from rest to a speed of 25 m/s in 7.5 seconds. Calculate the average power developed by the car's engine.
A planet has a mass of 6.4 x 10^24 kg and a radius of 9.7 x 10^6 m. Calculate the gravitational field strength at the planet's surface.
Question
Superman needs to stop a runaway train weighing 5,000 kg that is moving at 20 m/s. If he applies a force of 10,000 N, how long will it take for the train to come to a halt?

A hockey player slides a puck across the ice with an initial speed of 25 m/s. If the coefficient of kinetic friction between the puck and the ice is 0.1, calculate how far the puck will slide before coming to a stop.

During a magic show, a magician pulls a tablecloth from under a 0.5 kg vase sitting at rest on the table. If the tablecloth experiences a frictional force of 10 N and is pulled with a constant speed in 0.2 seconds, what is the length of the tablecloth?
A toy rocket is launched straight up with an initial velocity of 50 m/s. Calculate the maximum height it reaches and the time it takes to return to the ground.

A diver at the end of a springboard of negligible mass is modeled as a point mass of 75 kg. The springboard behaves like a spring with a spring constant of 15000 N/m. How much is the springboard depressed when the diver is at rest on the end?
A soccer ball is kicked at a 40° angle with the horizontal with an initial speed of 20 m/s. Calculate the time of flight and the horizontal distance traveled by the ball.
An archer releases an arrow at 45 m/s at a target 180 m away. At what angle above the horizontal must the archer aim to hit the target?

A spy in a high-speed chase is on a motorcycle traveling at 30 m/s. If they need to make a tight 90-degree turn without reducing their speed, what is the minimum coefficient of friction required between the motorcycle's tires and the road?
A student drops a 100 g apple from a building. It hits the ground with a speed of 20 m/s. Assuming no air resistance, calculate the height of the building.
In a video game, a character with a mass of 80 kg uses a jetpack to fly upwards. If the jetpack provides an upward force of 900 N, calculate the character's upward acceleration.
A wizard levitates a 2 kg book to a height of 5 m above the ground at a constant velocity. Calculate the work done by the wizard's spell.
An astronaut on a planet with a gravitational acceleration of 3.7 m/s² jumps with an initial speed of 4 m/s. Calculate the maximum height the astronaut reaches and the total time spent in the air.

A vampire bat flies towards a sleeping camper at a speed of 3 m/s. If the camper is 30 m away and the bat's echolocation emits sound waves at 340 m/s, how long will it take for the echo to return to the bat after it initially detects the camper?

A pirate ship fires a cannonball with an initial velocity of 60 m/s at an angle of 30° above the horizontal. Calculate the range of the cannonball assuming it lands at the same elevation from which it was fired.

A scientist observing a chemical reaction in a closed container notices a 0.5 kg ball moving back and forth with a period of 2 s. Assuming the motion is simple harmonic, calculate the spring constant of the system.
A medieval trebuchet launches a 100 kg boulder with a speed of 30 m/s at a 45° angle. Calculate the energy needed to launch the boulder and the maximum height reached.

A pirate is swinging on a rope from the mast of his ship to land on an enemy ship. If the rope is 10 meters long and the pirate's mass is 80 kg, calculate the velocity of the pirate as he lands on the other ship, assuming he started from rest and the ships are at the same elevation.
A knight in full armor (mass of 100 kg) is jousting on a horse that accelerates from rest to a speed of 10 m/s in 5 seconds. Calculate the average power output of the horse during the acceleration.
A wand in a wizard duel emits a spell that exerts a 200 N force on an opponent's shield for 0.3 seconds. If the shield is stationary and massless, calculate the impulse delivered to the shield.
An alien spacecraft descends to Earth with a uniform acceleration. If it takes 8 seconds for the spacecraft to go from 100 m/s to a complete stop, calculate the distance it travels during this time.
An enchanted frog with a mass of 0.25 kg leaps to a height of 2 meters. Calculate the initial speed of the frog's leap and the take-off angle if the jump took 1 second.

A robot moves a 200 kg crate across a factory floor by applying a horizontal force of 400 N. If the crate starts at rest and moves 5 meters in 3 seconds, calculate the coefficient of kinetic friction between the crate and the floor.

A witch flies on her broomstick with a constant velocity of 25 m/s. If she encounters a headwind exerting a force of 50 N against her flight for 10 seconds, calculate the change in her kinetic energy.

A medieval catapult launches a 5 kg rock vertically upward with an initial speed of 40 m/s. Calculate the maximum height the rock reaches and the time it takes for the rock to return to the catapult's launch platform.

A time traveler steps out of his time machine with an initial speed of 3 m/s to avoid detection. If he slows down uniformly and comes to rest in 2 seconds, calculate the distance he covers during deceleration.
An apprentice wizard casts a spell that accelerates a 0.1 kg potion bottle from rest to 15 m/s in 1 second. Calculate the net force exerted by the spell and the impulse delivered to the bottle.
A vampire throws a 0.2 kg silver bullet at a werewolf at a speed of 50 m/s. Calculate the kinetic energy of the bullet just before it strikes the werewolf.

A ninja throws a shuriken with a mass of 0.05 kg in a horizontal straight line towards a target 20 meters away. If the shuriken hits the target 0.5 seconds after being thrown, calculate the initial velocity and the force exerted by the ninja during the throw.
An ice giant hurls a 1 kg icicle from the top of a 50 m cliff at a velocity of 15 m/s, 30 degrees below the horizontal. Calculate the speed of the icicle just before it hits the ground.

A sorcerer levitates a stone with a mass of 30 kg to a height of 10 meters in 5 seconds. Assuming the acceleration is uniform, calculate the work done against gravity and the power exerted by the sorcerer.

In a futuristic sport, a hoverbike with a mass of 250 kg accelerates from rest to 20 m/s in 4 seconds on a track with a friction coefficient of 0.05. Calculate the thrust force provided by the hoverbike's engines.

A dragon breathes fire to propel itself backward. If the dragon has a mass of 500 kg and the speed of the fire jet is 100 m/s with a mass flow rate of 2 kg/s, calculate the acceleration of the dragon when it starts breathing fire.

During a magic carpet race, a carpet accelerates from 0 to 60 m/s in 7 seconds. If the rider and carpet have a combined mass of 90 kg, calculate the force exerted by the magic carpet during acceleration.

A superhero needs to jump over a 20-meter wide chasm. If they can accelerate at 9.8 m/s² for the 2-meter distance of their run-up, calculate the speed at which they take off and whether they make it across.
An inventor claims her new jetpack can lift a person straight up at a constant speed of 5 m/s. If the person wearing the jetpack has a mass of 70 kg, calculate the thrust force of the jetpack.

A sorceress casts a freezing spell that can decrease the temperature of a 1 kg cup of water from 25°C to 0°C in 10 seconds. Assuming the specific heat capacity of water is 4.18 kJ/(kg·°C), calculate the power of the spell.

A superheroine punches a villain with a force of 800 N. If the contact lasts for 0.1 seconds and the villain has a mass of 90 kg, calculate the velocity with which the villain is thrown backward after the punch.

A gadgeteer creates a grappling hook gun that shoots a hook with a mass of 0.5 kg to a ledge 30 meters above. If the gun propels the hook with an initial velocity of 25 m/s upwards, calculate the hook's kinetic energy halfway to the ledge.

In a battle between robots, a robot fires a laser that delivers energy at a rate of 5000 Joules per second. If the laser hits the opposing robot's armor, causing it to heat up and absorb all the energy for 3 seconds, calculate the total energy absorbed.
A wizard apprentice drops a 0.1 kg crystal ball from a tower 50 meters high. Calculate the velocity of the crystal ball just before it hits the ground and the time it takes to fall.
An astronaut on the moon (where the acceleration due to gravity is 1.625 m/s²) drops a hammer from a height of 1 meter. Calculate the time it takes for the hammer to hit the lunar surface.

In a mock duel, a knight's lance, with a mass of 4 kg and a length of 3 meters, is used to strike a stationary training dummy. If the lance is moving at 10 m/s just before impact, calculate the angular velocity of the lance when held at one end and rotated around the other.

A cyborg throws a steel ball of mass 0.8 kg with a speed of 12 m/s. If the steel ball is in contact with the cyborg's hand for 0.05 seconds, calculate the average force exerted by the cyborg's arm during the throw.
A fantasy creature jumps from the ground to a height of 3 meters. If the mass of the creature is 50 kg, calculate the minimum force their legs must exert during the jump.

A detective uses a magnifying glass to focus sunlight onto a piece of paper, igniting it in 5 seconds. If the power of the concentrated sunlight is 6 Watts, calculate the total energy delivered to the paper.

A science fiction hero is trapped in a room that is slowly filling with water. If the hero's mass is 80 kg and they need to swim upwards with an acceleration of 0.3 m/s² to reach an air vent, calculate the force they need to exert against the water.
A fairy weighs 0.5 kg and can fly by beating its wings to create a downward thrust. If the fairy hovers in place, calculate the thrust force generated by its wings.
A time traveler moves back 2 minutes in time after every hour. If they continuously traveled for a day, calculate the actual duration of their journey accounting for the time reversals.

In a virtual reality game, a player throws a virtual ball weighing 0.2 kg with a force of 50 N. If the ball was in contact with the player's hand for 0.08 seconds, calculate the initial acceleration of the ball.
A space pirate's ship accelerates at 3 m/s² to escape a space station. If the ship maintains this acceleration for 60 seconds, calculate the final velocity and the distance covered during this time.
A dragon exhales fire for 10 seconds, expelling hot air at a speed of 50 m/s. If the mass flow rate of the air is 2 kg/s, calculate the thrust produced by the dragon's breath.
A wizard's staff can emit a beam of force that exerts 1000 N on a target. If the target is a 2 kg enchanted stone suspended in mid-air, calculate the acceleration of the stone when hit by the beam.

A group of adventurers row their boat across a river at a steady velocity of 2 m/s. If they encounter a magical current that adds 1 m/s to their speed, calculate their new velocity and the time it takes to cross a 100-meter wide river.

In an epic space battle, a cruiser fires a missile with a mass of 500 kg at a velocity of 200 m/s. If the explosion on impact releases 1x10^6 Joules of energy, calculate the change in kinetic energy of the missile.
A superhero can run at a speed of 30 m/s. If they need to rescue someone 500 meters away within 10 seconds, calculate the minimum acceleration required to achieve this if they start from rest.

A phoenix in flight has a mass of 15 kg and can fly at a constant altitude by exerting a downward force equal to its weight. Calculate the force the phoenix must exert to ascend at an acceleration of 1 m/s².

A rogue AI controls a factory and starts producing robots. If it takes 5 minutes to assemble a robot and the AI improves its efficiency by 2% every hour, calculate the time to assemble a robot after 24 hours.
A mermaid can swim with an acceleration of 0.5 m/s² and starts from rest. If she swims in a straight line for 20 seconds, calculate the distance she covers.
A group of gnomes builds a catapult that launches rocks at a speed of 40 m/s. If they angle the catapult at 45 degrees, calculate the range of the rocks launched by the catapult.
In a mystical forest, a tree grows at a rate such that its height doubles every year. If the tree is currently 1 meter tall, calculate its height after 5 years.

A young sorcerer casts a spell that can lift objects with a force of 50 N. If they use this spell to levitate a 10 kg book, calculate the acceleration of the book and the maximum height it reaches if the force is applied for 2 seconds.
In a post-apocalyptic world, a survivor finds a bike that can travel at a constant velocity without friction. If they travel for 3 hours at a speed of 15 km/h, calculate the distance covered.

A knight in full armor is jousting at a tournament. The knight and armor have a combined mass of 120 kg, and the horse accelerates from rest to a velocity of 10 m/s in 7 seconds. Calculate the force exerted by the horse.

During a lunar mission, an astronaut drops a hammer and a feather from the same height at the same time. With no air resistance, both objects fall at an acceleration of 1.6 m/s². Calculate the time it takes for both to hit the lunar surface from a height of 1.2 meters.
A genie grants a flying carpet a constant acceleration of 4 m/s². Starting from rest, calculate how long it would take for the carpet to reach a velocity of 50 m/s.

In a science fiction universe, a beam weapon fires a pulse of energy that has a momentum of 800 kg·m/s. If the target is a stationary asteroid with a mass of 4000 kg, calculate the velocity of the asteroid after being hit, assuming a perfectly inelastic collision.
A magical orb falls from a tower in a fantasy world, accelerating at 9.8 m/s² due to gravity. If it takes 3 seconds to hit the ground, calculate the height of the tower.
A vampire bat accelerates at 2 m/s² for 4 seconds while chasing an insect. If the bat started from rest, calculate the final velocity and the distance traveled during the chase.
An alien spaceship can travel at speeds approaching light. If it travels at a speed of 2.5x10^8 m/s for 500 seconds, calculate the distance covered, assuming constant velocity.
A futuristic hoverbike races down a track with a constant acceleration of 6 m/s². If it starts from rest and accelerates for 10 seconds, calculate the distance covered during this interval.
A wizard dueling in an arena casts a spell that accelerates a 0.1 kg rock to 30 m/s in 0.2 seconds. Calculate the force exerted by the spell on the rock.

In a steampunk city, an inventor creates a mechanical bird that can fly at a constant speed of 15 m/s. If the bird needs to deliver a message to a location 2 km away, calculate the time required for the delivery.
A cybernetic organism can throw a steel ball with an initial velocity of 25 m/s at an angle of 60 degrees. Calculate the maximum height reached by the ball and the total time it remains in the air.
In a dystopian future, a rebel fires a railgun that accelerates a 0.01 kg projectile from rest to 3000 m/s in 0.001 seconds. Calculate the average acceleration and the force applied.
A wind mage summons a gust that applies a force of 120 N to a 20 kg boulder, moving it a distance of 5 meters. Calculate the work done by the wind mage on the boulder.

In a mythical underwater city, a submersible vehicle designed to resist extreme pressures can accelerate from rest to 20 m/s in 12 seconds while ascending. Calculate the acceleration and the distance traveled in this time.
A ghostly apparition can move through walls as if they don't exist. If it accelerates at 3 m/s² for 4 seconds through a wall 12 meters thick, calculate the final velocity as it exits the wall.
